resource.chars:
the parietes of the stomach to the upper 
part of the walls of the visceral chamber,
forming a sort of little sheath for the 
base of the posterior division of the adductor 
muscle, and which I will call the 
<u>gastro-parietal band <\u>; and a lower,
which passes from the middle of the
intestine to the parietes - supporting 
the so-called ‘<u>auricle <\u>’ - I will call 
this, the <u>Ilio-parietal <\u> band.
The Ilio-parietal and gastroparietal bands
are united by certain other ridges upon 
the fibrous coat of the intestine - from where 
point of union in the middle line of 
the stomach posteriorly a pyriform 
vesicle depends.
The mesentery divides the line into 
two lateral lobes - while the gastroparietal 
bands give rise to the appearance of these 
being again divided into two <s>vertical <\s> tubules one above the other
